website_summaries.verdict: A versatile flea and tick preventative by a top brand that's a good alternative to collars and topical treatments.
pros: Garners enthusiasm for working quickly – users have bragged about seeing fleas "fall off" their pets while using it
Can be used on kittens and dogs, too
cons: A few reports of minor skin irritation on cats' skin
Owners should wear gloves when applying it
May not work in all situations, or may have to be reapplied to kill all pests

customer_reviews.title: No bobcat fever!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this to treat my cats for fleas and ticks. It is one of the few that protects cats from ticks. I've had 2 cats that got bobcat fever, one died. Vet told me to give a couple of squirts to the back of the neck (where you put the topical flea stuff) once a month. Waaaaaaay cheaper that the normal topical thingys and just as effective. I've been using this for 8 years on my cats...no fleas, no ticks in all that time, but especially no bobcat fever.
customer_reviews.author: NorthFlorida

customer_reviews.title: A big decrease in ticks after just 24 hours.
customer_reviews.text: We have a really bad tick problem and just treating the yard wasn't cutting it. My two dogs would get approx. 20 ticks between the two of them in 1-2 days. After only 24 hours of spraying them we are already seeing a drastic decrease and only found 1 tick on one dog and 2 on the other. We were getting them under their paws in between the pads. Make sure when you spray your dog that you spray under their feet and between their claws too. One of our dogs is medium sized and the other between medium/small and we used almost half the bottle to thoroughly cover them both.
customer_reviews.author: j. bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Because of the weight and size of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Because of the weight and size of my Chihuahuas, it was required for safety reasons to put the product on my hands first, then just rub it into their fur on the skin, this way it wouldn't be to strong for them. It worked like a charm and last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it does absolutely nothing and honestly I have gotten this ...
customer_reviews.text: it does absolutely nothing and honestly I have gotten this from the vet before and it worked. I am convinced this is no the real product and all I smell is rubbing alcohol which is the last thing my dog needs on his sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: karelyn russ

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money on an inferior product that cannot used!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this product for years on our small dogs, never had a problem until the last bottle ordered, it is defective the sprayer does not work and we cannot remove the lid to replace it with the last bottle used! Very disappointed, praying our little. Ones do NOT get fleas!!! Must be a second, will buy elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Not just for Cats and Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I purchase and use this not on my dogs and cats, but my horse! He gets really nasty mites in late summer to mid fall and he is severely allergic to the bites. As soon as I see the hives he gets from the bites, I use the spray and it kills them instantly. And before any one freaks out, yes it was recommended by my vet. It takes the whole bottle, but it's worth it to make him more comfortable and kill the little buggers making him miserable.
customer_reviews.author: book_lover

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than buying at my veterinarian.
customer_reviews.text: it kills the fleas. This stuff is twice the price at my veterinarian. I don't know why 'poisoning' our pets has to be so expensive. This stuff is the only product out there that i can use on the feral cats (when they let me get close enough) that i know will kill fleas, but it especially helps keep the fleas off my fur babies (dogs).
customer_reviews.author: Debra Todd

customer_reviews.title: It works for us.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for years on our cats and dogs to keep fleas and ticks away. Once a month we just give them a squirt at there neckline behind their head and one at their tail much like the tubes you buy. If we know we are going somewhere that could be tick infested we give them an extra light spray all over. It seems to have worked for years using it like that.
customer_reviews.author: NPG

customer_reviews.title: Smelled like rubbing alcohol
customer_reviews.text: Did anyone buy this ND it smelled like rubbing alcohol? I boutique one before lost a year ago. But I don't recall it smelling like rubbing alcohol. I boutique this one just last week, I got it in just 2 days ago. As I was putting in onto my cat, my kids noticed and asked why I was putting rubbing alcohol on the cat. I did realize that it was familiar to the alcohol. I don't recall it smelling like that before...did anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Heidi P

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Worked good but not it won’t last a month if you don’t cover the whole body with it. It will kill fleas on contact. I think is better for ticks. Fleas are harder to kill. But you can give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It goes on quickly and that works so much better for my cat and I than the measured out ...
customer_reviews.text: It goes on quickly and that works so much better for my cat and I than the measured out monthly doses. Now getting her flea medicine is a quick and easy process. I'll be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frontline Flea & Tick
customer_reviews.text: This is what I always used when I lived in Florida and it worked great on our 3 dogs. Hopefully it works just as well in WV. We live near the woods and ticks are always a concern... Will update after summer... Packaged arrived on time
customer_reviews.author: Mark Michael

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my cats
customer_reviews.text: Item was poorly shipped in a bag. Half of the product had been squeezed out of the bottles. What was left of the product was completely ineffective at killing the super fleas on my cats. I could actually rub this stuff on the fleas and at best they seemed to just get annoyed. All I can honestly say is for whatever reason this stuff did not kill our fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Product seemingly had more alcohol than actual Frontline. It was very ineffective and didn't do much to control fleas past the day of spraying the animals. I feel the same thing could have been achieved by screwing a sprayer nozzle onto a bottle of rubbing alcohol. The Frontline spray was just as irritating to their skin as alcohol can be as well. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonRN

customer_reviews.title: Purrrfect
customer_reviews.text: It really works well for indoor and outdoor pets. No fleas on the stray cats since I used this product. All around? 10/10 easy to use and no smell
customer_reviews.author: MissMadamKitty

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much true what all the others are saying
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much true what all the others are saying. Something has changed or this is simply a bootleg product. I can't even get the nozzle to change to spray so that my only option is to stream whatever is really in this bottle directly onto my animals. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Diane V Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Worked all right. We were pretty consistent with vacuuming and using this. It subdued fleas but didn't help for removal.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: It works great killing fleas and is easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: My vet suggested this product as I have 7 cats and 2 large dogs. It works great killing fleas and is easy to apply. Con-you must wear gloves to keep the product off your skin and it takes a little while for it to dry completely.
customer_reviews.author: lori m cart

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Used to be a fantastic product. Ordered it on a regular basis. They changed something, does not work for any of our animals, and we have given multiple chances
customer_reviews.author: Terrance

customer_reviews.title: Does not appear to work any more
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought the spray from this seller and it works wonderfully however, this last bottle smelled different and I used an entire bottle on my two dogs and its not killing the fleas. Usually an 8.5 oz bottle will last at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: Primy McPrime

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work. AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this spray for years. Alway impressed. I'm not sure if they changed the formulation or I got a bad batch but my latest bottle didn't work well. My dogs still have fleas.
customer_reviews.author: belzan

customer_reviews.title: Thsnk Goodness for this product!
customer_reviews.text: Great when you have small kittens. My vet says it is ok to use with kittens of any age.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harrigan

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use, has a slight scent that evaporates as it dries. So far this has been the best for my small one. His previous owner recommend this and I will forever be thankful.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Violet

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Terrible smell and results.
customer_reviews.text: Negative reviews were completely correct. The directions would literally have me soak the dog head to toe, which would make them gag on the stench of alcohol that was overwhelming after two sprays alone. Effective only on fleas you shoot directy...does nothing long term. Don’t both with it.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee F.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great for our dog and it also works great on killing ants.
customer_reviews.author: v r

customer_reviews.title: Frontline, safe for fleas
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a diluted version of the old Frontline. We dog board and a guest left some little friends in our dogs and cats. This doesn't seems very effective. Day after applying I can still conb out fleas. This bothers the pets and is inconvenient having to keep repeating the treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Kills fleas dead. My brother lives in the country. It can also be used on puppies and he had a new litter Saved the day! Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product does not deliver. It's expensive and has no affect on fleas
customer_reviews.author: Annie Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Fleas are gone
customer_reviews.text: Even though the price keeps going up, I keep using it because it is the best and this has the best price. It works great for my dogs down here in the Gulf coast. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: cpowellpumphrey

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness.
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind paying if it works. And it does. It's the only thing that has worked for my basset.
customer_reviews.author: G McCuskey

customer_reviews.title: Did what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Heard thisbwas avquick safe way to control/prevent snake mites So far so good
customer_reviews.author: TJ Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: Good for spot needs
customer_reviews.text: While convenient, this isn't the best product for flea control. It's a spot solution when needed, but to provide continuous protection, the pets will need something else. It requires a good dosage (sprays) to fulfill the directions listed on the bottle, but the results aren't compelling. However, it will clear out the fleas from a problem area in a jiffy.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Mcgregor

customer_reviews.title: ... my cats up to a point that he looked like just came out of a shower
customer_reviews.text: After I sprayed my cats up to a point that he looked like just came out of a shower, I still brush out fleas. It does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You have to be really careful with this and maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to be really careful with this and maybe on large dogs it might be o.k., but it made the tummies red and irritated on my little doggies. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: It did kill the fleas immediately. Took a whole ...
customer_reviews.text: It did kill the fleas immediately. Took a whole bottle for our pit bull; which didn't leave any for our husky. It only worked for about 2 weeks. Definitely NOT worth the expensive price.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the real deal! It got rid of the fleas in my house in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Fear of cancer.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for many years and find it best, because of the worry about using other products that produce cancer. Best for cats, but sand fleas can get used to it...
customer_reviews.author: E.J. Albers Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Frontline used to work for my dog and cat yet...it doesn't seem to work for them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: GUSTAVIA

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know that Frontline was available in spray. Have ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know that Frontline was available in spray. Have 6 puppies, vet told me to ok to apply. Spray in gloves hand and rub over pup.
customer_reviews.author: M. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I am using it on a Great Pyrenees pup and have not seen a flea or tick on her. However, she is only 35 lbs now. When she reaches 100+ lbs this will no longer be cost effective. Would recommend for a smaller dog.
customer_reviews.author: Arby

customer_reviews.title: freaking amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on 3 dogs and 2 cats, dogs weight ranging from 3-55 lbs. Fleas immediately started surfacing to the top of the fur jumping and dying off, awesome!
customer_reviews.author: HeatherRenee

customer_reviews.title: Works great, never had a problem with fleas or ticks ...
customer_reviews.text: I own multiple dogs and this saves me a ton of money. Works great, never had a problem with fleas or ticks using this product
customer_reviews.author: Amy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Works fast and well
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works fast and well. Will buy again. Can’t say my pets like it, but we do hahahaha
customer_reviews.author: jayneway

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap item because it doesn't work really well. Maybe because the coverage is not really good when you have to spray it on and rub it with your hands on their fur. The fleas seem to just keep moving to different spots. I bought the pill and it works better than this, the pill wasn't that much more in price. This also made my dog's fur shed a bit when it was applied.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalJimz

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I would have gotten the same results if I had sprayed water on my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: Frontline Flea and Tick Treatment Dog/Cat Spray, 8-1/2-Ounce
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping ...packed well ... love Frontline spray .... lasts a long time since I only have one small dog ..and works better than anything else I've tried ...had to buy it on line cause my vet no longer carries it ...and its not in my local stores either ...been told it has something to do with the spray bottle ..I haven't had any problems with it ....hope they continue to carry it .on line ..
customer_reviews.author: Marilynn A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works well, less expensive.
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. If you've found that the regular stuff (small dose) doesn't work, try this - it works way better on one particular cat than the other. For some reason, one cat of our two is particularly flea-infested, and this worked well on him, when the other didn't. And, it's cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Decent but looking for even better product
customer_reviews.text: Strong smell of alcohol. I think this is why the dog and our cats freak out when its\'s sprayed on them. It must be burning them like alcohol on an open wound. As long as you rub this stuff in, it works ok. Though, our fluffy cat still has tons of eggs and can't seem to kill these fleas on her.
customer_reviews.author: Prime4Life

customer_reviews.title: but when I bouģht this from this seller it was like spraying water on my doggies and did nothing to ...
customer_reviews.text: Dont think this is the real deal as this has always worked in the past when purchased at my vet office, but when I bouģht this from this seller it was like spraying water on my doggies and did nothing to combat their flea issues.
customer_reviews.author: Light eyez

customer_reviews.title: The smell is very strong. It does kill fleas ...
customer_reviews.text: The smell is very strong. It does kill fleas for 1-2 days, but then they are back in full force. it is a small bottle and needs to soak the fur. Not cost effective or a solution a real flea solution.
customer_reviews.author: Octpumpkin Mama

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the fleas are much worse this summer than at any time in the four years we've had our little dog. WE tried everything and nothing seemed to work. On the advice of a friend we ordered Frontline Flea and Tick Treatment Dog/Cat Spray. It worked wonders. This will be the main weapon in our flea arsenal from now on. Gotta admit it was fun watching the little bugs run to the tip of her nose trying to get away from Frontline!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this spray doesnt work but the topical treatment does.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work as advertised. I've used the topical and it works wonderful but not the spray. Spray it directly at a flea on my dog and it did nothing. I would not waste money on the spray. Just do yourself a favor and get frontline topical treatment. And the only reason I gave it a 2 stars is because of the topical treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Thien L.

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my dogs when we have to visit the outside world. I dont have a flea problem at home but this stuff is the best for pups over 8 weeks and for homes that dont have a flea problem. It last for one month with out the super large price tag. This item is not like the over the counter products that dont work. Give it a try and I promiss you wont go back.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase!  Thanks
customer_reviews.text: The flea and tick treatment arrived safely and in good order. Everything looks great. And the shipping was amazingly fast!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Seller

customer_reviews.title: Verdict is still out
customer_reviews.text: The verdict is still out on this product. Supposedly good for 30 days. Hasn't been much more than 14 and my house cat has flea bites under her neck again. Time will tell whether it does what it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Ford

customer_reviews.title: solved lice problem in 10 week old puppy
customer_reviews.text: This product topically kills lice on puppies without being too harsh or going directly to their bloodstream as an oral medication would. One treatment solved our problem in our new 10 week old puppy
customer_reviews.author: Terri Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Smells like pure rubbing alcohol and it may have stopped the dogs and cats from scratching for 10 minutes at the most. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the drops.
customer_reviews.text: I use this once every 2 weeks on my dogs and cats. It does have a chemically smell but it doesn't linger for long. If you have multiple pets I highly recommend this because it is significantly cheaper than the drops and you can use it on both dogs and cats.
customer_reviews.author: Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Frontline F&T to the Rescue
customer_reviews.text: My vet put me on Frontline F&T treatment 20 years ago when I got my 3rd Boston Terrier. The fleas were heavy in the grass in the back yard, but the Frontline, after a good spraying, kept them off her. My new Boston experience the same thing in the grass and again, Frontline has eliminated the fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd M Willis, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It did pretty good at killing the fleas on my dogs but ...
customer_reviews.text: It did pretty good at killing the fleas on my dogs but didn't really keep them away. The dogs didn't much care for it though
customer_reviews.author: Micah Hays

customer_reviews.title: My poor cats had a visitor with a flea issue and ...
customer_reviews.text: My poor cats had a visitor with a flea issue and this really did the job. Follow instructions and don't overdo the first treatment.
customer_reviews.author: FJ

customer_reviews.title: At first this stuff was the miracle cure for my ...
customer_reviews.text: At first this stuff was the miracle cure for my dog. She's been extremely sensitive to fleas her whole life, but this most recent bottle hasn't been doing the same magic. We get more than the occasional flea and I'm not sure why. New mixture? What's up yo?
customer_reviews.author: Library Lady Katie

customer_reviews.title: Use for baby puppies
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my baby puppies. It works really good for my younger puppies
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Kates

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for multi pet owners # 1 spray for my pets.
customer_reviews.text: If you can't afford the monthly pill for every pet this is the product for you. I have used this for 20 years and never had a problem with pest.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot of Ohio

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Frontline Flea and Tick for years because it actually works! No nasty smell and economical to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this online and smelled like alcohol. My dog started to itch and rub ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware! Ordered this online and smelled like alcohol. My dog started to itch and rub herself frantically against the fence as soon as i sprayed it on her. Not sure what is going on but I read other reviews saying the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: M. Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Semi effective
customer_reviews.text: Slows down active fleas but does not eliminate all fleas or eggs.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Very good price though
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as described but there was some leaking in the package. Very good price though, much more expensive to buy locally.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This did not keep fleas off of kittens at all!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, though nothing can totally rid you of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very effective, though nothing can totally rid you of the problem of fleas, completely. My only problem is the strong alcohol smell, but it does go away quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed with the results -- I expect better from Frontline ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the results -- I expect better from Frontline -- the fleas returned within 2-weeks. I will use one more time to see if maybe I did something wrong and will update afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible shipping time!
customer_reviews.text: Love Frontline but didn't like the 3 week shipping time.

customer_reviews.text: I run a cat rescue and we get animals from all over. Many come from the streets or the country and are flea infested. This product works great and is safe!

customer_reviews.title: great product.
customer_reviews.text: Kills fleas on dogs, cats and kills mites on chickens.

customer_reviews.title: First time using frontline and very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: So I sprayed my whole apartment with this last week and didn't see any fleas since. First time using frontline and very happy with my purchase.

customer_reviews.title: The best flea killer
customer_reviews.text: Best flea killer put there. I tried many brands and Frontline is the best product that really works. My dogs are now flea free.
customer_reviews.author: Hancock Chan

customer_reviews.title: Vials work better
customer_reviews.text: Really did not help my dogs flea problems at all this past summer and fall. I won't buy this again. The small vials work much better than the spray. My suggestion is to stick to the vials.
customer_reviews.author: kjw

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is so handy to use and apply with either short-haired or long-haired felines.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work very well for our animals.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to try, since the price was very low for the amount of product I would get. It seemed to kill fleas, but irritated their skin. It seemed that the fleas were going back to the animals within a few hours of applying the spray, too. I went back to Bayer Advantage with much better results.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Courtier

customer_reviews.title: This product continues to make me happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in the past, and I am happy to report that it continues to do the job - killing the fleas. Just after application, the fleas start falling off of my kitties. I highly recommend this product - it is safe and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... not work ive used frontline before and it was great but this time it didnt not one bit
customer_reviews.text: it did not work ive used frontline before and it was great but this time it didnt not one bit!

customer_reviews.text: my dog cries when i use this on her, and she got fleas anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: worked great on all four of my pets
customer_reviews.text: worked great on all four of my pets! Cleared up the fleas on the first day only problem is now there jumping on me. So You'll need to use other flea products for the house. But this is a cheaper alternative to drops and works faster in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Shadrick

customer_reviews.title: Cats still have fleas
customer_reviews.text: My cats love going outside I've sprayed my cats three times and they still have fleas. It has a very strong chemical smell.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly coated my dog and two cats. A couple of fleas died right away when the spray hit them, but most of them lived. I am trying to find a different product that works.
customer_reviews.author: DENICE J LAESSIG

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it a 0 I would. This product is a waste of money. I think they just fill the entire bottle full of alcohol. I'm no longer a frontline fan. Won't buy any of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: brittaney

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: The NUCLEAR OPTION for fleas! For the first step in getting rid of those little nasty fleas, this stuff is where its at. Use the front line first then buy an upholstery spray for the rest of your house and say goodbye to fleas. I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure if this stuff works. My dogs still scratch even with proper application.
customer_reviews.author: Christal Love Carson

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! Product damaged
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived damaged. Over half of the bottle leaked out in the bag. Very disappointed as this item is hard to find and I am unable to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mathers

customer_reviews.title: A Flea Treatment that works
customer_reviews.text: Effective ! Works well , we had mild winter & wet spring , perfect for fleas. Has been a real winner.
customer_reviews.author: BANDERABOB

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought for both my dog and cat. Other than wearing latex gloves. I don't have any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: margaret haralson

customer_reviews.title: This beats any other brand be it tablets, spot ...
customer_reviews.text: This beats any other brand be it tablets, spot on, etc. It will kill ticks and fleas immediately if you spray evenly and make sure the coat is saturated. A second application might be needed if pet has severe infestation. I've always try out other options each year but end up back with Frontline spray.
customer_reviews.author: Bridesmaid

customer_reviews.title: So glad I can find this on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: So glad I can find this on Amazon. We have multiply outdoor cats, and try to keep them all pest free. This spray works on them all and I even spray the neighbors dogs to try to keep our yard pest free as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be working just as well as the little individual capsules that we used to put on them. It's easy to apply and is much more affordable!
customer_reviews.author: NeatFreak

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: The cheaper choices are just that....cheap. This stuff works on a special kitty who has a very unpleasant reaction to those back-of-the-neck drops. As usual, Amazon beats the competitors price. Add a cat toy or two and the order ships free. I really need a life...
customer_reviews.author: Still young, but wiser

customer_reviews.title: Used to work well 15 years ago, now doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Still have fleas. This stuff used to work incredibly well when I used it about 15 years ago, but either today's fleas have developed an immunity or they've changed the formula.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A tiny tube of Frontline contains something like 9. 8% of the active ingredient
customer_reviews.text: It's mostly alcohol. A tiny tube of Frontline contains something like 9.8% of the active ingredient, however, this big bottle containers less than 1% of that same ingredient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for me every flea and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for me every flea and tick season. 3 Dogs and 6 Cats it works every year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and after using on both of my dogs there is pleanty left for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Mccarty

customer_reviews.title: Great flea product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I am happy with the product. The price might seam high but it doesn't take alot to work.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

product_meta.title: Frontline Flea and Tick Treatment Dog/Cat Spray, 8-1/2-Ounce
feature_bullets: Flea and tick treatment spray-on topical flea control formula can be applied directly to pets to provide fast-acting control of fleas and ticks for up to 30 days
Spray bottle is easy to use, ensures fast and even application and can be reapplied regularly
Kills fleas before they lay eggs, effectively preventing reinfestation
Contains fiprinol to kill pests quickly and safely; safe for dogs, puppies, cats and kittens 8 weeks or older
